page.title: 12KING STERNDALE:BUTTER CROSS
page.content: The cross is{3 giant stones on top of {each other.}There are 4 giant semi-circle stones layed around the bottom of the cross. You can tell the stones are very old and have been worn away by the rain, for they have big holes in parts. {On the market days the people {would sell items and goods around the {cross.}The cross's real title is the { {butter cross.}It is said to be the { {oldest relic in King Sterndale.} People say it is medieval. In the coronation year of King George VI, 1937, the parishioners of the village church raised money for the cross to be repaired. The Butter cross lies in an overgrown field at the far end of the village. Now all that lies there is a few houses, a farm and fields.
